name: [SECRET_VALUE]
description: The script generates a PPPoE configuration file to /etc/ppp/pppoe.conf, using the uvm tool to process the template file /usr/uo/pppoe.conf.uo. It is necessary to check the content of the template file to confirm whether it contains hardcoded credentials.
notes: It is recommended to further analyze the contents of the /usr/uo/pppoe.conf.uo file to confirm whether hardcoded credentials exist.

name: PPPoE-config-empty-user-field
description: An empty 'USER=' field was found in the PPPoE configuration file, which may be used to store the PPPoE REDACTED_[SECRET_VALUE]_PLACEHOLDER. Although the current value is empty, the presence of this field indicates that the system might store [SECRET_VALUE]entication credentials in this configuration file.
notes: Although no actual credentials were found, the file structure suggests it may be used for storing PPPoE [SECRET_VALUE]entication information. It is recommended to monitor modifications to this file or check whether sensitive information has been populated during deployment.

name: PPPoE-standard-config-params
description: Multiple network configuration parameters were found, including DNS settings and connection timeouts, but no obvious sensitive information was identified.
notes: These are standard PPPoE configuration parameters and do not contain obvious sensitive data.

name: PPPoE-pidfile-config
description: PID file path configuration detected, possibly used for process management.
notes: This is normal system configuration information and does not pose a security risk.

name: httpd-config-analysis
description: Configuration file analysis completed. No hardcoded credentials or sensitive information were detected. This configuration file only contains basic HTTP server performance parameter settings.
notes: Although no sensitive information was found, it is still recommended to regularly check such configuration files, as sensitive configurations may be added during actual deployment.

name: [SECRET_VALUE]
